result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham Michael Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by July 28, 2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abraham Michael Lopez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abraham Michael Lopez in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by July 28,2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Abraham Michael Lopez in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12/11/2014

Defendant Abraham Michael Lopez in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment of the pretrial conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Abraham Michael Lopez
Current: 332 N 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 02-13-2015)
Prior: 332 N 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Abraham Michael Lopez in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/13/15 @ 1 PM

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12-11-14
